description.value: Adult outpatient needing Cardiology consult for arrhythmia evaluation
Clinical Providers in Primary Care Clinic
Ensure a minimum workup is initiated prior to a Cardiology Consultation for adult patients who present to a Primary Care Clinic for evaluation of atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter

1301000205107 |Implantation of cardiac resynchronization therapy implantable pacemaker (procedure)

title.value: Clinical Stability

description.value: This documentation template is not applicable for use with patients who are unstable based on clinician judgement. Examples of unstable patients include, but are not limited to, patients with chest pain pattern suggestive of Acute Coronary Syndrome ( ACS ), symptomatic hypotension, or unstable arrhythmia. Consider transferring these unstable patients to the nearest emergency department immediately.

title.value: History and Physical

prompt.value: History of prior cardiac evaluations (e.g., prior hospitalization or evaluations for: chest pain, rule/out MI, angina, heart failure, etc.)
Results of prior cardiac diagnostic procedures performed (resting ECG, echocardiogram, stress testing (echo, nuclear, MRI), Cardiac CT ( CCT ) and Coronary CT Angiography ( CCTA )
Physical Exam, Pertinent Positive and Negative Findings

title.value: Implanted Device History
If a device is selected, then enter Current arrhythmia device programmer interrogation report.

code.code: 1301000205107 |Implantation of cardiac resynchronization therapy implantable pacemaker (procedure)

displayText.value: Prior Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy plus Implantable Cardioverter-Defibrillator (CRT-D) Device Implantation

prompt.value: Current arrhythmia device programmer interrogation report

title.value: Treatment Provided
Laboratory Studies
Imaging and Diagnostic Studies

description.value: For this documentation template, the following information should be included, if available from the prior year.
Link results: Rest/Stress Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Interpretation
Link images: Rest/Stress Magenetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)

title.value: Stroke and Bleeding Risk

description.value: Ask the following questions and check any of the following that apply to the patient.

prompt.value: Active problem of congestive heart failure or active problem of left ventricular systolic dysfunction?
History of stroke or of problem of transient ischemic attack or thromboembolism?
